title: How To Make Healthy Eating A Habit
summary: Eating well doesn’t have to be hard or feel like a chore, it can be something you enjoy and look forward to. Try a new food at least once a week and make food more interesting and enjoyable. Eating with others can also help you make better choices, as you’re more likely to choose a salad over a carb-heavy side when others are watching. Set an intention before each meal can help you focus on what you're eating. Reward yourself for sticking to your diet.

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Commit to meal prep."),mdx("p",null,"This may seem like an obvious one, but we promise it\u2019ll help. If you don\u2019t want to force yourself to eat the same foods day after day, you may struggle to keep up with your habits long term. Meal prepping will help you make sure you\u2019ve got healthy food on hand that\u2019s ready to go when you are. You\u2019d be surprised at how much better you\u2019ll feel when you\u2019re not running around trying to grab something unhealthy at the last minute. Plus, prepping your food ahead of time is a great way to keep track of your daily calorie intake without having to track every detail of everything you\u2019re eating."),mdx("h2",null,"Try a new food at least once a week."),mdx("p",null,"Part of making healthy eating a daily habit is exploring new kinds of foods as often as you can. Trying new things can help you find new favorites to add to your diet and make food more interesting and enjoyable. This can also make it easier to switch up your daily routine and shake things up a bit, so you don\u2019t feel like you\u2019re always eating the same old meals. Giving new foods a chance can also help you learn more about ingredients and nutrition in general, so you\u2019re more able to make informed choices at the supermarket."),mdx("h2",null,"Set an intention before every meal."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re someone who tends to eat on the fly, setting an intention before each meal can help you focus on what you\u2019re eating. This may sound silly, but it can help you slow down, be more aware of what you\u2019re consuming and make improvements to your diet. Whether you want to focus on eating more vegetables, having less sugar or trying to increase your protein intake, setting an intention before every meal can help you stay on track."),mdx("h2",null,"Take your vitamins."),mdx("p",null,"This is something you may have been told since you were a kid, but it\u2019s just as important as ever as an adult. Adults, teens and even kids who eat a well-rounded diet can struggle to get enough nutrients from food alone. This is especially true for vitamins like B, C, D and Calcium, as well as Iron for women who are menstruating. Getting enough of these nutrients can help keep you healthy, improve your energy levels and make sure your body is operating at its best."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t eat alone."),mdx("p",null,"This may sound odd, but research has shown that eating with other people can help you eat less. Eating with others can also help you make better choices, as you\u2019re more likely to choose a salad over a carb-heavy side when others are watching."),mdx("h2",null,"Reward yourself for sticking to your diet."),mdx("p",null,"This may sound a little silly, but it\u2019s a good idea to reward yourself for eating healthily. When you\u2019re committed to a new way of eating, it can help to have something to look forward to. This could be anything from a trip to the movies, to a new book, a relaxing bath and more. Find something that fits your lifestyle and makes you excited and eager to keep up with your diet choices."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"When you commit to eating healthier, it can be easy to feel like it\u2019s something you have to force yourself to do every day. Hopefully, these tips show you that it doesn\u2019t have to be that way. Eating well doesn\u2019t have to be hard or feel like a chore. It can be something you enjoy and look forward to."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Exercises You Can Do at Home and save a Ton of Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Who says working out has to be expensive? You can do it anywhere and anytime. There are various affordable home workout videos available on the internet as well. However, that doesn\u2019t mean you have to break the bank when trying to save money in other areas of your life. Those at-home videos might seem like your only cheap option, but there are plenty of ways you can cut down on costs while still getting the same benefits from working out at home.
Instead of splurging on a one-time membership or an expensive series of DVDs, why not invest in some home equipment that won\u2019t cost you a fortune, but will help you get in great shape? Working out at home also has its advantages: no traffic jams and no gym membership fees! Here are 10 cheap home workout ideas for anyone who wants to slim down and tone up without breaking their budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Cravings and Temptations
How to Eat Healthy on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`How much does buying healthy food cost? For some it might be a small splurge, for others, a luxury they can\u2019t afford. Either way, eating healthy on a budget isn\u2019t easy. Eating less processed and pre-packaged foods is one way to cut costs and stay healthy at the same time. Another way is to get creative and buy things when they are on special or use cheaper alternatives like frozen or canned versions of fruits and veggies instead of the fresh ones. There are many ways to do this that won\u2019t leave you feeling deprived while still giving your body what it needs to be healthy.
For those who eat a lot of fast food or find themselves eating unhealthy because it\u2019s cheaper than buying wholesome foods, these tips will help you make healthier choices while saving money at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Plant-Based Foods for Optimal Health
5 Ways to Destress after a Long Day

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...s}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...s,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Everyone has stressful days at work or school. It\u2019s normal to feel overwhelmed and exhausted after an intense day. However, there are ways to recover from this stress and return to normalcy quickly. There are simple ways to destress after a long day that don\u2019t require much time. In fact, these techniques can be implemented in as little as 10 minutes.
Destressin g is good for you and your mental health. When we\u2019re stressed, our body interprets it as danger so it produces cortisol and other stress hormones to prepare us for fight or flight. These natural chemicals are useful in limited quantities but when they remain high for prolonged periods of time, they have negative effects on our health by increasing blood pressure and blood sugar levels, decreasing immune response, weakening bones, and increasing body fat storage. Stress also increases risk of heart disease and depression.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Eat Healthy When You're Short on Time
Top Health Benefits of Meditation and How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Meditation is one of the most effective ways to bring your mind and body back into balance. This ancient practice has been proven to help decrease stress, anxiety and depression, while also improving memory and concentration. In addition to these benefits, research shows that meditation can also have a positive impact on your immune system, blood pressure and heart health by lowering your levels of the stress hormone cortisol and lifting your levels of oxytocin (a \u201Clove hormone\u201D).
In this article, we take a look at some of the top health benefits of meditation and how you can get started today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Get Your Kids to Eat Their Vegetables
The Health Benefits of Walking - And How to Get Started

Just lace up and go, right? In theory, yes. But in practice, getting yourself out the front door and walking for a length of time may seem like quite the challenge, especially if you don\u2019t have a gym membership or access to any other kind of workout facilities.However, as with anything else in life that may seem difficult at first but is actually beneficial for your well-being in the long run, there are plenty of ways to make walking more accessible and enjoyable for you. Here are some tips on how you can get started on that walking routine and keep it going..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
